page.title: 02THE ESTATE OF CRATHES
page.content: The estate of{Crathes}is one of the oldest in{Deeside}dating from the early{14th}century when it was granted to the ancestors of the{Burnett}family by{King Robert the Bruce.}It remained in the ownership of the{Burnett's} until{1951}when{Sir James Burnett of {Leys}granted the castle and policies to the{National Trust for Scotland.} The castle _ the older part of which dates from{1528}_ and gardens are the most popular show-place in{Royal {Deeside}(after{Balmoral Castle} itself). The estate amounts to{595} acres{(240}hectares) comprising of{400 acres of forest (mainly conifers),{103 acres of arable farming,{52}acres of policies and gardens and{3.75}acres of walled formal gardens.
